intro: Urostigma platypodum f. glabrior, commonly known as the smoothleaf false dandelion, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, glabrous (smooth) leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features include a creeping rhizome system and hairy stems, which distinguish it from other similar species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
